Mass. reports 873 new coronavirus cases, 76 new fatalities; UMass model predicts death toll will rise over 8,100Even as the state tiptoes toward reopening, the state reported Tuesday that the death toll from the coronavirus outbreak in Massachusetts had risen by 76 cases to 5,938, and a new model from the University of Massachusetts Amherst predicted the toll would rise to 8,106 in the next four weeks.
The latest coronavirus numbers from Massachusetts
Walsh says Mass. reopening plan is a ‘thoughtful’ approach but still worries about Boston
Ayanna Pressley warns Mass. is reopening too quickly, asks Baker to ‘re-evaluate his timeline’
BC intends to hold classes on campus
Here’s what the Massachusetts reopening plan says about colleges, K-12 schools, and day care

How to stay safe from coronavirus as you venture out during Mass. reopening  We asked several public health experts about how to best adapt to life in the Coronaverse. Their main advice: proceed with caution.
Mass. houses of worship can reopen under new guidelines, and a new CDC study shows why
Key takeaways from Baker’s reopening plan
Here's what can reopen in each phase of Massachusetts’ opening plan

Frustrated North End restaurateurs, still waiting to reopen, consider their optionsIn a neighborhood defined by its iconic Italian eateries, some restaurateurs were vexed after learning in-person dining wasn't part of the first phase of Governor Charlie Baker's reopening plan.

From salons to boutique gyms, small businesses try to parse what reopening will look like
Office work gets green light, but many white-collar employers will still stay home

An industry vision emerges for how summer camp might work in the COVID-19 eraChildren may have to wear masks for indoor activities, and they’ll be placed in small groups to contain any possible exposure.

Organizers remain cautious about hosting Boston Marathon on rescheduled September dateThe BAA and the city of Boston are working to avoid canceling the race for the first time in 124 years, but social distancing more than 30,000 runners and a million spectators will be difficult.

kevin cullenThey were a couple of healers. Now one is charged with murdering the otherDr. Ingolf “Harry” Tuerk and his wife Kathleen “Katie” McLean devoted their lives to healing people. Now she’s dead and he’s accused of murdering her at their Dover home, in a horrific case that shows domestic violence knows no boundaries.

‘We are not a virus, we are human beings.’ Trump’s China bashing could alienate Asian-American voters Efforts by the president and his allies to blame China for the coronavirus outbreak have led to pushback by Asian-American leaders. They're also urging Joe Biden to be careful not to join in the criticism just to avoid looking soft on China.

Maine delays full reopenings of gyms, nail salons; officials report 2 deaths, 28 new coronavirus casesThe businesses were slated to reopen on June 1 under Stage 2 of Mills’ four-stage plan to reopen the state’s economy, which has been in place for nearly three weeks.

Archdiocese of Boston plans televised memorial Mass for those lost to coronavirusPeople are invited to submit the names of loved ones lost to COVID-19 to be remembered during the May 29 Mass at www.CatholicTV.org/memorial.

New mask under development at MIT could detect coronavirus, report saysA new mask that can potentially detect COVID-19 just by when a person sneezes, breathes, or coughs is under development at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, according to a recent report from Business Insider.

Experts predict long, slow climb toward economic recoveryIt will be well into summer, at the earliest, before most consumer-facing businesses are allowed to resume operations, and it will be a slow, fitful process from there as consumers get comfortable again with shopping in stores, eating at restaurants, and going back to the gym.
